fields.summary: Make HTTP timeout configurable in ADLS Connector

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.description: HADOOP-15356 aims to expose the ADLS SDK base timeout as a configurable option in Hadoop, but this isn't very testable without being able to read it back after the write logic has been applied.
fields.summary: Upgrade to ADLS SDK that exposes current timeout

comments.body: I ran the ADLS integration tests with this (no failures) and reviewed the code in the last couple of commits here: https://github.com/Azure/azure-data-lake-store-java/commits/2.2.9.

{quote}The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests. Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch. Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch{quote}

We don't usually add new tests for SDK bumps, but about the only feature we could reasonably test is tested by the dependent JIRA. Tests run described above.

The patch is trivial (one line bump to pom version).

Looked at some recent SDK changes:
 * 2.2.9. Add shouldRetry() logic and retry policy for requesting tokens from MSI.  Looks ok. 404 is retry-able, for example. Max retry wait is 1+2+4+8=15 seconds.
 * 2.2.8. Default ADL request timeout from 5 to 60 seconds.
 * 2.2.7 Looks like support for different type of MSI endpoint (add support for GET as well as POST). Improved exception text when getTokenSingleCall() gets an error response (even including bytes of the response msg).

LGTM +1 based on your testing.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14117 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14117/])
